item.title: Extractives for Growth Program (E4G) – Operations Manager
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Objectives of the role:

As part of the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade’s (DFAT) consolidated Sub-Saharan African Aid program, Extractives for Growth (E4G) will be one of three key components. Through E4G, Australia will focus its assistance in three areas where the greatest potential for generating shared value between governments, communities and industry exists: skills development; extractives and communities; and the enabling environment. These are areas that: represent major risks for the private sector; are key to governments leveraging maximum development value from their extractives resources; will determine the employment and livelihood benefits that flow to communities; and require (and provide opportunities for) partnerships between governments, industry and communities to find solutions. The new program will harness Australia’s extractives-related expertise (private sector, government, non-government organisation, research and training).

E4G will focus on three target countries (Tanzania, Zambia and Mozambique) where Australia can maximise development benefits, and where there is a commitment by the government and private sector to improve the social benefits and economic growth opportunities from a well-managed and transparent extractives sector.

In addition, ‘enabling environment’ activities will be conducted in 8-10 countries in Sub-Saharan Africa. These countries are likely to include Madagascar, South Africa, Ethiopia, Ghana and Nigeria, with the remainder yet to be determined.

Extractives for Growth Program (E4G) – Operations Manager

Qualifications and Skills:

  • Proven communication and negotiation skills and an ability to work in a variety of cultural settings
  • Fluent in English. Proficiency in French and Portuguese will be considered an asset

General Professional Experience:

  • Excellent communication skills and an ability to work with a wide range of stakeholders
  • Excellent project management skills
  • Proven ability to deliver long-term development programs

Specific Professional Experience:

  • Experience working in the extractives and natural resources fields
  • Previous work with the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade’s (DFAT) is desirable
  • Significant experience working in Sub-Saharan Africa

Please send your CV to brian_green@dai.com. Due to the high number of applicants, if you have not been contacted by the application closing date then please assume your application has been unsuccessful.

item.title: Australia Awards – Team Leader
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Objectives of the role:

As part of the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade’s (DFAT) consolidated Sub-Saharan African Aid program, Australia Awards will be one of three key components. Australia Awards are prestigious international scholarships offered by the Australian Government to the next generation of global leaders. Australia Awards provide opportunities for long-term (Masters) and short course study and professional development, aiming to develop capacity and leadership skills so that individuals can contribute to development in their home country.

Scholarships have been a key part of Australia’s aid program to Africa since the 1960s, providing over 5,000 scholarships across the continent and are an important development and public diplomacy tool in Sub-Saharan Africa. In addition to building critical skills and knowledge, they foster an engaged and influential network of leaders, reformers and advocates driving development across the continent, contributing to Australian economic diplomacy objectives and promoting valuable links between Australia and African countries.

Australia Awards will be comprised of:

  • Australia Awards Scholarships: demand-driven Masters undertaken at Australian universities, to be offered to approximately 11 Sub-Saharan African countries.
  • Australia Awards Africa Short Courses: tailored short (two-three months) post-graduate courses in sectors where Australia has recognised expertise and which are areas of priority to partner governments (agriculture, extractives and public policy). Offered to approximately 22 Sub-Saharan African countries, short course awards will be delivered through Australian registered training organisations, in partnership with African institutions to promote relevance.
  • Australia Award Fellowships: short-term opportunities for study, research and professional attachment in Australia, delivered by Australian organisations. Currently available across Africa to nominated fellows from eligible countries (this will be delivered through a global program external to the AADP).

Qualifications and Skills:

  • Tertiary degree in a relevant discipline
  • Proven communication and negotiation skills and an ability to work in a variety of cultural settings
  • Fluent in English. Proficiency in French and Portuguese will be considered an asset

General Professional Experience:

  • Excellent communication skills and an ability to work with a wide range of stakeholders 8 Proven ability to deliver long-term development programs

Specific Professional Experience:

  • At least 8 years of previous experience as a Team Leader on development programs
  • Proven experience of working with regional scholarship programs
  • Experience working in Sub-Saharan Africa
  • Previous work with the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade’s (DFAT) is desirable

Please send your CV to sarah_owen@dai.com. Due to the high number of applicants, if you have not been contacted by the closing date, please assume your application has been unsuccessful.

Experto en Seguridad Fronteriza/Evaluación (Jefe de equipo – Categoría I)

Características generales:

  • Formación universitaria, de preferencia en Ciencias Sociales o equivalente, siendo una ventaja estudios de post grado en temas relacionados con la misión.
  • Experiencia sólida y diversificada en el campo/ámbito del conocimiento específico necesario y requerido, incluyendo experiencia no menor a 5 años en monitoreo y/o evaluación de proyectos, en particular de al menos 5 años en proyectos relacionados con la temática de la evaluación.
  • Experiencia en Centroamérica y conocimiento de los procesos políticos y dinámicas existentes en la región.
  • Capacidad y experiencia no menor de 7 años en la planificación y gestión del ciclo de proyectos y de procedimientos de cooperación.
  • Profundo conocimiento del idioma castellano, hablado, y escrito, así como capacidad comprobada de redacción de Informes.
  • manejo de herramientas informáticas y conocimiento de las fases del ciclo del proyecto y del Marco Lógico según la Unión Europea, así como de la metodología de evaluación de la ayuda exterior de la UE.

Características específicas:

  • mínimo cinco (7) años de experiencia (10 años preferible) en diseño o ejecución o monitoreo y evaluación de programas, de los cuales se pide 4 años de experiencia en temas relacionados con la temática de la misión.
  • Se requiere un sólido conocimiento de los métodos y técnicas de evaluación de proyectos. Es imprescindible tener experiencia en evaluación de proyectos de la Unión Europea.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Nicolas_fichers@dai.com

item.title: Senior Expert for Strategic planning and Committees (Deputy Team Leader)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The Deputy Team Leader/Strategic Planning and Committees' expert will lead on the strategic advice, conceptualisation, implementation and oversight of actions related to Result 1 and Result 2 of the project and in particular to the assistance for Strategic Plans exercise, overall systematic committee support and strengthened committee functioning (review/amendment of Rules of Procedure), Human Resource assessments and parliamentary cadre for the Secretariat. To perform these tasks, the expert will be supported by long term and short term senior expertise as well by the junior expertise.

Deputy Team Leader/Senior Expert for Strategic Planning and Committees

Qualifications and Skills:

  • University degree at Masters' level in social and/or political science, public and/or business administration, law, economics or related discipline or with experience of at least 15 years
  • Excellent leadership, management, communication (written and oral), networking and reporting skills
  • Ability to work at senior parliamentary level; ability to work under pressure and to meet strict deadlines
  • Proficiency in written and oral English language

General Professional Experience:

  • At least ten years professional experience in parliamentary-related work and/or public administration, extensive experience in institutional strengthening and strategies, institutional capacity-building, parliamentary committee system and rules of procedure
  • Experience in project management, including in the design, budgeting, implementation and monitoring of projects, preferably related to parliamentary or public administration affairs
  • Exposure to international committee parliamentary practices is an advantage
  • Experience with EU procedures is an advantage

Specific Professional Experience:

  • Experience with parliamentary committees functioning, parliamentary Rules of Business and in strategic planning
  • Experience in institutional related support to public administration, the legislative sector and/or the private sector and in matters pertaining to oversight of the executive in developing countries
  • Experience in cooperating with donors, international organisations, public administrations and civil society
  • Good familiarity with gender concepts

item.title: Team Leader – Pakistan: Support to Democratic Institutions
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The Team Leader will support the EU Delegation, the Assemblies' stakeholders and the Technical Assistance (TA) team in achieving the overall objective and purpose of the project. In particular, the Team Leader will lead the TA team in assisting, supporting and building the capacities of the Provincial Assemblies and Legislative Assemblies to strengthen the three parliamentary functions and the performance of the Assemblies. The Team Leader is responsible for the overall project coordination and execution, including (but not limited to) supervision of professional staff and experts, establishment and review of programmatic and budgetary priorities, submission of required work plans and reports, and communication and coordination with all stakeholders. The Team Leader will also assist the EU Delegation in tasks related to the facilitation of donor coordination as well as in task related to the Project Steering Committee and specific working committees for the four Provincial Assemblies.

Team Leader – Pakistan: Support to Democratic Institutions

Qualifications and Skills:

  • University degree at Masters' level in social and/or political science, public and/or business administration, law or related discipline. Can be substituted with relevant professional experience of at least 15 years
  • Excellent leadership, management, communication (written and oral), networking and reporting skills
  • Ability to work at senior parliamentary level - ability to work under pressure and to meet strict deadlines
  • Proficiency in written and oral English language

General Professional Experience:

  • At least ten years professional experience in the field of development work related to parliamentary work, institutional development and strengthening, public administration, good governance, institutional and civil society capacity building, political parties' development, and/or other areas related to formulation of public policy and/or scrutiny, including five years of management experience. Prior experience of a combination of all these areas is an advantage
  • Experience in project management, including in the design, budget preparation, implementation, and monitoring of projects and programmes, preferably in parliamentary institutional development. Experience in a management position or as project Team Leader
  • Experience in working in multi-donor context; Experience in EU funded cooperation projects is an advantage
  • Experience with EU procedures is an advantage
  • Sound knowledge of EU policies and programmes in the area of human rights, democratisation and good governance is an advantage
  • Good familiarity with gender concepts

Specific Professional Experience:

  • Experience in managing comprehensive parliamentary development actions
  • Good knowledge of and working experience in the areas of parliamentary work including provision of technical assistance
  • International parliamentary experience and/or exposure to international parliamentary practices
  • Experience in providing institutional support to public administrations/parliaments in matters pertaining to parliamentary regulatory frameworks and processes in developing countries

item.title: Senior Communications Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The Communications Expert shall lead in the advice, conceptualisation, implementation and oversight of actions related to Result 3 of this project relating to improving the transparency and accessibility of assemblies. The expert will lead on the development and implementing communication strategies, increasing the Assemblies' capabilities to disseminate information to the public for more participatory governance and to deliver timely information and documents to the members. The expert will work closely with the Secretariat’s respective branches, Parliamentary leadership, Committees, media. Together with the other experts, the expert will also assist on effective parliamentary and Committees' engagement with the media and the public (civil society, lawyers, bar associations, think tanks) for provision of input into parliamentary legislative and oversight business) and for improving the quantity and quality of media repotting on parliamentary business.

Senior Communications Expert

Qualifications and Skills:

  • University degree at Masters' level in media and communication, public relations, law, in social and/or political science, public administration or related discipline with experience of at least 15 years
  • Excellent leadership, management, communication (written and oral), networking and reporting skills
  • Excellent analytical skills and ability to conceptualise policy formulation within the subject area
  • Ability to work at senior parliamentary level; ability to work under pressure and to meet strict deadlines
  • Proficiency in written and oral English language

General Professional Experience:

  • At least ten years professional experience working within media and/or communication and/or Public Relations (PR)
  • Experience with international donor-funded programmes or experience on management position preferred
  • Exposure to international parliamentary practices in the areas of communication/PR is an advantage

Specific Professional Experience:

  • In-depth understanding of and experience with media, in the sectors of communications as well as public relations
  • Experience in strategic communications, development and implementation of communication strategies and systems for the public administration, private sector and/or legislative sector (parliament)
  • Solid knowledge of digital media, communication and outreach, and web content management system and process
  • Understanding of information and communication technologies is an advantage
  • Experience in liaising with civil society, lawyers, bar associations, think tanks, public administration and others
  • Knowledge of the concept and practice of the representation function of the parliament involving timely and quality public outreach and public input into parliamentary business
